title: Overcoming Challenges Together
description: Discover how you face difficulties as a team.

questions.text: When we face a challenge together, my first instinct is to...
choices: Analyze the situation and make a plan
Focus on staying calm and grounded
Talk through it with you right away
Take action and figure it out as we go

therapeutic.rationale: Initial responses to challenges reflect problem-solving styles. Analyzers need understanding before action; calmers prioritize emotional regulation; talkers need verbal processing; actors need movement. Knowing your partner's first instinct helps you work together.
therapeutic.whenDifferent: Different first instincts can complement each other. The analyzer can plan while the actor starts executing. The talker can process while the calmer provides stability.
therapeutic.whenSame: Shared first instincts create immediate synchrony when challenges arise.
therapeutic.journalPrompt: What's your first instinct when facing a challenge? How does it work with your partner's approach?

questions.text: During tough times, I need you to...
choices: Be my rock and stay steady
Problem-solve alongside me
Just listen and understand
Remind me we'll get through this

therapeutic.rationale: Support needs during challenges vary. Rock-seekers need stability; problem-solvers need collaboration; listeners need to be heard; reassurance-seekers need hope. Giving the wrong type of support can feel unhelpful despite good intentions.
therapeutic.whenDifferent: Different support needs require adaptation. Ask 'What would help you most right now?' rather than assuming what your partner needs.
therapeutic.whenSame: Matched support needs make helping each other during tough times intuitive.
therapeutic.journalPrompt: What kind of support do you need most during challenges? Have you clearly communicated this?

questions.text: What I've learned about us from past challenges is...
choices: We're stronger than we realized
Communication is key for us
We handle stress differently
We always find our way back to each other

therapeutic.rationale: What couples learn from challenges becomes part of their shared story. Recognizing strength builds confidence; valuing communication reinforces connection; acknowledging differences builds understanding; trusting reconnection builds security.
therapeutic.whenDifferent: Different learnings from challenges are complementary. Both perspectives add richness to your shared narrative.
therapeutic.whenSame: Shared learnings from challenges create aligned understanding of what helps you succeed together.
therapeutic.journalPrompt: What has facing challenges together taught you about your relationship?

questions.text: After we overcome something difficult, I like to...
choices: Celebrate and acknowledge our success
Reflect on what we learned
Move forward without dwelling
Feel grateful and closer to you

therapeutic.rationale: How couples process success after challenges matters. Celebrators need acknowledgment; reflectors need learning; movers need progress; gratitude-feelers need connection. Post-challenge rituals can strengthen the relationship.
therapeutic.whenDifferent: Different post-challenge needs may feel mismatched. The reflector may want to process while the mover wants to move on. Make room for both.
therapeutic.whenSame: Shared post-challenge preferences create natural closure rituals after difficult times.
therapeutic.journalPrompt: How do you like to process success after overcoming something difficult together?

questions.text: I believe challenges in a relationship...
choices: Can make us stronger if we face them together
Reveal what really matters to us
Test our commitment and communication
Are opportunities for growth

therapeutic.rationale: Beliefs about challenges shape how couples approach difficulties. Growth-oriented beliefs help couples see challenges as opportunities rather than threats. This reframe supports resilience and connection.
therapeutic.whenDifferent: All these beliefs support healthy challenge navigation. They're different angles on the same growth-oriented perspective.
therapeutic.whenSame: Shared beliefs about challenges create aligned expectations and approach when difficulties arise.
therapeutic.journalPrompt: What do you believe about challenges in relationships? How does that belief help you?
